SPELLBOOK.Cantrips.CannotUnlearnMore: You can only unlearn one cantrip during this swap
SPELLBOOK.Cantrips.EnforcementHint: Controls how cantrip rules are enforced when characters attempt to make changes.
SPELLBOOK.Cantrips.LevelUpDefault: You've gained new cantrips! Your cantrips have been unlocked for selection.
SPELLBOOK.Cantrips.LevelUpModern: You've leveled up! You can now learn new cantrips and unlearn one of your existing cantrips.
SPELLBOOK.Cantrips.LockedLegacy: Cantrips cannot be unlearned with legacy rules.
SPELLBOOK.Cantrips.LockedOutsideLevelUp: Cantrips can only be changed during level-up under these rules.
SPELLBOOK.Cantrips.LockedOutsideLongRest: Cantrips can only be changed during a long rest under these rules.
SPELLBOOK.Cantrips.MaximumReached: You've reached your maximum number of cantrips
SPELLBOOK.Cantrips.MustUnlearnFirst: You must unlearn a cantrip before learning a new one
SPELLBOOK.Cantrips.OnlyOneLearn: You can only learn one new cantrip during this swap.
SPELLBOOK.Cantrips.OnlyOneSwap: You've already swapped one cantrip. You must complete this swap before making another.
SPELLBOOK.Cantrips.OnlyOneUnlearn: You can only unlearn one cantrip during this swap.
SPELLBOOK.Cantrips.RulesHint: Controls how cantrips can be changed once selected. Legacy rules make cantrips permanent while modern rules allow swapping.
SPELLBOOK.Cantrips.SwapAvailableNotifica: {name} can now swap one cantrip in the spellbook.
SPELLBOOK.Cantrips.WizardRuleOnly: This rule is only available for Wizard characters
SPELLBOOK.Preparation.AlwaysTooltip: This spell is always prepared and doesn't count against your prepared spell limit
SPELLBOOK.Preparation.AtMaximum: You've reached your maximum number of prepared spells
SPELLBOOK.Preparation.AtWillTooltip: This spell can be cast at will and doesn't require preparation
SPELLBOOK.Preparation.InnateTooltip: This spell is innate and doesn't require preparation
SPELLBOOK.Preparation.PactTooltip: This spell is part of your Pact Magic and doesn't require traditional preparation
SPELLBOOK.Preparation.RitualTooltip: This spell can be cast as a ritual and doesn't need to be prepared
SPELLBOOK.Rest.UpdateSpells: {name} has completed a long rest. Would you like to change which spells are prepared?
SPELLBOOK.Settings.DefaultCantripRulesHi: Which rules to use for cantrip handling by default. These can be overridden per character.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.DefaultEnforcementBeh: How strictly to enforce cantrip rules by default. These can be overridden per character.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.DisableCantripSwapPro: If enabled, you won't be prompted to swap cantrips after a long rest, but the option will still be available when you open your spellbook.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.DistanceUnit.Hint: Choose the unit to display and filter spell ranges
SPELLBOOK.Settings.DistanceUnit.Name: Distance Unit
SPELLBOOK.Settings.EnableRestPrompt.Hint: Prompt player to update prepared spells after completing a long rest.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.EnableRestPrompt.Name: Prompt After Long Rest
SPELLBOOK.Settings.FilterInstructions: Enable or disable filters using checkboxes. Drag filters with grip handles to reorder them. Some filters have fixed positions and cannot be moved.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.FixedPositionDesc: This filter has a fixed position
SPELLBOOK.Settings.Logger.Hint: Set the level of logs generated by Spell Book. The troubleshooter will catch everything regardless. Recommended: Warnings.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.Logger.Name: Logging Level
Opens the GM Spell List Manager to create and modify spell lists.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.Saved: {name}'s spell book settings have been saved
Number of spells to show per page in the GM Spell List Manager.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.Title: Spell Book Settings
SPELLBOOK.SpellSource.GrantedTooltip: This spell is granted by a feature or item and cannot be unprepared
SPELLBOOK.UI.ResetTooltip: Reset (Shift+Click to clear all prepared spells)
SPELLBOOK.Wizard.AtMaximumSpells: You have reached the maximum number of spells in your spellbook.
SPELLBOOK.Wizard.LegacyCantripRules: Legacy Rules: Cantrips cannot be changed during a long rest.
SPELLBOOK.Wizard.ModernCantripRules: Modern Rules: You may swap one cantrip during a long rest.
SPELLBOOK.Wizard.MustUnlearnFirst: You must unlearn a cantrip before learning a new one.
SPELLBOOK.Wizard.NewSpellsInfo1: When you find a wizard spell of 1st level or higher, you can add it to your spellbook if it is of a level for which you have spell slots and if you can spare the time to decipher and copy it.
SPELLBOOK.Wizard.NewSpellsInfo2: For each level of the spell, the process takes 2 hours and costs 50 gp. The cost represents material components you expend as you experiment with the spell to master it, as well as the fine inks you need to record it.
SPELLBOOK.Wizard.NoCantripsOnLongRest: Wizard cantrips cannot be changed during a long rest under legacy rules.
SPELLBOOK.Wizard.OneSwapLimit: You can only swap one cantrip during a long rest.
SPELLBOOK.Wizard.PrepareInfo: You prepare the list of wizard spells that are available for you to cast. Choose a number of wizard spells from your spellbook equal to your Intelligence modifier + your wizard level (minimum of one spell).
SPELLBOOK.Wizard.PrepareInfoTab: You prepare the list of wizard spells that are available for you to cast. To do so, choose a number of wizard spells from your spellbook equal to your Intelligence modifier + your wizard level (minimum of one spell).
SPELLBOOK.Wizard.RitualCastingHint: Enable casting ritual spells directly from your spellbook without preparing them
SPELLBOOK.Wizard.RitualInfo: You can cast a wizard spell as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag and you have the spell in your spellbook. You don't need to have the spell prepared.
SPELLBOOK.Wizard.RulesVersionHint: Choose between modern or legacy rules for wizard spellbooks
SPELLBOOK.Wizard.SpellsPerLevelHint: Number of spells gained automatically when leveling up
SPELLBOOK.Wizard.StartingSpellsHint: Number of level 1 spells to start with at character creation
SPELLBOOK.Wizard.SwapCantripPrompt: You've completed a long rest. According to modern rules, you may swap one of your prepared cantrips. Would you like to do this now?
SPELLBOOK.Wizard.Title: Your Wizard Spellbook
SPELLBOOK.Wizard.Unavailable: The Wizard Spellbook is only available for characters with the Wizard class.
SPELLMANAGER.Application.Title: GM Spell List Manager
SPELLMANAGER.Columns.AddSpellsPrompt: Select spells from the right panel to add them to this list.
SPELLMANAGER.Columns.EditPrompt: Select a spell list and click "Edit" to customize it.
SPELLMANAGER.Columns.NoListSelected: Select a spell list from the left column to view its contents.
SPELLMANAGER.Columns.NoSpells: This spell list contains no spells.
SPELLMANAGER.Confirm.DeleteContent: Are you sure you want to delete the custom version of {name}? This cannot be undone.
SPELLMANAGER.CreateList.IdentifierNotes: An identifier can only contain lowercase letters (a-z), numbers (0-9), dashes (-), and underscores (_).
SPELLMANAGER.CreateList.ValidationError: Invalid identifier format. Please use only lowercase letters, numbers, dashes, and underscores.
SPELLMANAGER.Documentation.Creation.Cont: Select a spell list from the left column. Click the "Edit" button to create a custom copy. Add or remove spells using the right panel. Click "Save" when you're done.
SPELLMANAGER.Documentation.Creation.Step: Select a spell list from the left column.
Click the "Edit" button to create a custom copy.
Add or remove spells using the right panel.
SPELLMANAGER.Documentation.Integration.C: When a player opens their Spell Book, the system will check if a custom version of their class spell list exists, use your custom version if available, or fall back to the original list if no custom version exists.
SPELLMANAGER.Documentation.Modifying.Con: Custom lists will show additional controls:
Delete Custom Version: Remove your custom version.
Restore from Source: Reset the list to match the original.
SPELLMANAGER.Documentation.Modifying.Not: If the original list has been updated since your customization, you'll see a notification.
SPELLMANAGER.Documentation.Overview.Cont: The GM Spell List Manager allows you to browse, duplicate, and customize spell lists from compendiums. These customized lists can then be used by players in their Spell Book.
SPELLMANAGER.Documentation.Practices.Ite: Create custom lists before your players create characters.
Test custom lists with dummy characters before using them in your game.
Keep a backup of important custom lists by exporting them.
Consider communicating list changes to players before making major modifications.
SPELLMANAGER.Documentation.Title: GM Spell List Manager Documentation
